title: How to Draw a Peeled Banana

steps.headline: Draw a long, narrow oval.
steps.description: Slightly curve the ends up. (Use a very soft pencil or light hand to draw this step.)

steps.headline: Bring the bottom of the oval to a point.
steps.description: This makes the bottom end of the banana. (Use a slightly darker lead.)

steps.headline: Add three curves.
steps.description: One curve to the right of the banana; one to the left; and one across the middle. Make the two side curves more acute than the middle one.

steps.headline: Draw a curvy triangle, using the middle curve as a base.
Add more curves to compete the sides.
Add final details.
steps.description: Define the final edges with a darker lead pencil, or with more force. Color if desired.

text: Draw a long, narrow oval. Slightly curve the ends up. (Use a very soft pencil or light hand to draw this step.) Bring the bottom of the oval to a point. This makes the bottom end of the banana. (Use a slightly darker lead.) Add three curves. One curve to the right of the banana; one to the left; and one across the middle. Make the two side curves more acute than the middle one. Draw a curvy triangle, using the middle curve as a base.  Add more curves to compete the sides.  Erase unwanted lines.  Add final details. Define the final edges with a darker lead pencil, or with more force. Color if desired.
